alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 7:17PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pondera, southeastern Glacier and west central Toole Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valier, or 14 miles northwest of Conrad, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential downpours Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cut Bank, Valier and Ethridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
